artist: Artist: Philip Gallo; Publisher: Hermetic Press, Minneapolis
creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
description:
a. At home with paper rock scissors, 1975
Hermetic Press, Minneapolis

b. Concrete poem number one, 1970
Hermetic Press, Nacodoches, Texas; Ed: 4/75

c. Three Views of the sky's the limit
a poem in the form of a kaleidoscope, 1975
with three photographs by Ned Gardner
H. 4 3/8" x W. 4 3/8"
Hermetic Press, Minneapolis (75 copies printed)

d. A concrete poem, 1975; Ed.: 1/50
4 sheets, H. 7" W. 3 1/8" each; acetate overlay H. 7 1/2" x W. 3 7/8"
text is printed from two Benday dot screens
Hermetic Press, Minneapolis

e. Laura, 1974; silkscreen from Letraset Palace Script
(Stephenson Blake)
Hermetic Press, Minneapolis (75 copies printed)

(cover sheet enclosed)
Dedicated to Harry Duncan
provenance: Philip Gallo, Minneapolis; sold to MIA, 1977.
title: Four Concrete Poems and a Reconstruction of a Fifth
